Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Raluca D
Reviews.Content: Except for the location, which is absolutely great, the nice staff and the fact that the room was clean and quite cheep (250 euros for 5 nights - 2 persons), there's nothing good I can say about the hotel. Everything there is very very small - room, bathroom, breakfast room, kitchen. The room in which we stayed (226) was I think 3 meters long and 2 meters wide, with the most uneven walls I ever saw in my entire life. It was so bad that the bed could not be in any way positioned to be parallel with the side walls even if it was perpendicular on the wall behind it - boggles the mind. However, it was clean and recently renovated by the looks of it and if you're not planning to spend too much time in the room it's ok. The internal court yard looks horrible - dirty and old - and you have no sun light in the room. I didn't get much rest because in the morning, at around 7, when breakfast starts, you can hear people passing on the corridor, and if you're a light sleeper you'll wake up for sure. I think it's worse if you stay on the first floor - where the reception is - or near the sliding door from floor 2 - which I could hear even from a long distance away. Breakfast is very very poor - 2 kind of cereals, bread, butter and some kind of jelly they try to pass as being jam - don't pay for it. The room where it's served is very small and dark. Make sure you have ENOUGH CASH with you. You'll need to pay a fee for visiting Rome which is 2 euros/person/day and they don't accept credit card for that. Also some restaurants don't accept credit card, so make sure you ask first. But, as I was saying, the location is excellent, You're 1-2 kilometers away from the most well known tourist attractions - Fontana di Trevi, Colosseum, Bocca Della Verità, etc. Even if I was horrified when I first entered the hotel and the room, I think I'd go back for 2-3 more days - go figure that out :) Rome is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StarbucksFreak25
Reviews.Content: The hotel located close to termini station (5 min walk) and to the historical city center (10-15 min walk). The hotel is nice, the room was big, modern and comfy. The staff was very nice! Breakfast was very basic but nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Malvi12
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems a little bit shady going in at first... But its a small hotel with small rooms but very clean and it is in the middle of everything and very good neighberhood near the presidential palace.... Also there are two prime metro station within walking distance about two/three blocks. If on a budget its a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but only just.”
Reviews.Author: bluetrailers
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here, one midweek, one on a sunday. A tip - request a quiet room. It can be noisy on the street. I didn't have breakfast, but the room it was served in looked grim. The bedroom was tiny but comfortable both nights. A lot of street noise the second night - including a singing wino at three in the morning. The room the first night was on the second floor at the back and was better. Bathroom fine. Check rates as prices fluctuate and don't bother trying to pay with a credit card - they won't take it. Good location, overall this place is slightly the wrong side of average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cesar C
Reviews.Content: Smooth reservation, good location and good television (if you speak Italian, of course). Breakfast is good and generous, the beds are comfortable and the room is clean. Hosts and personnel are nice and eager to help. Recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Enthusiast_80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not what it says to be. Breakfast consisted only of coffee and bread. No cheese or ham as they show in the pictures. The room was clean and the bath is large enough, but the door did not close properly and with a single push opens despite it is in theory locked. There is a safe box in the room but they charge you extra if you want to use it (which can be much more importart if the door can't be closed). They also charge 15 Euros more to use the air conditioning even if it is only for a while (the room was very warm during the evening and it was september). The personeel that is there during the evenings is very friendly, but everything changes with the people who are there during the day. Beware also if you get a room on the same floor as the reception as you will be constantly awaken with everything that happens out there, Finally they also take their toll on your vacation time by insisting that you get cash to pay all your bill instead of by credit card (any card, not even the same credit card you used to book and guarantee your stay) So they had us finding a way to call our bank abroad to see if we could withdraw a larger amount. By the end it was not possible to get that amout of cash specially as we were leaving back to the US that afternoon. and then, somehow, they finally decided to accept our credit card. However we had a hetic morning trying to get this sorted out instead of enjoying our last day of vacations in Rome. For what other travellers told me at the airport it is very common that hotels in Rome insist at the very last moment that you pay in cash, may be as a means to avoid paying taxes. I'm not sure if this is true but it really leaves you a bitter aftertaste of your holidays as they get very pushy and unfriendly with this issue.

Reviews.Title: “It's a 3 star hotel, and that's what it does best.”
Reviews.Author: Cynicoren
Reviews.Content: No major complaints, as there are also no major benefits to this hotel, but its location. The room (118) was cleaned each day. It was a very small room, with a small flat screen TV, an old safe inside the wall, restroom and a shower and even a bidet. The sink had a breaking signs on it, but still was whole. The staff were very friendly and nice, and attended our needs pretty fast (a bulb that went off was quickly replaced). On the other hand, we had a few problems with them - First of all, they were pretty misinformed. I asked about the "Angels and Demons tour", and I was told that it stopped a few years ago. 2 days later (too late for us) , I found out that it is still running. I asked about the train to the airport and I was told the wrong times. The other problem was, that when living, we wanted to pay with a credit card ( we ordered with a CC in advance from Hotels.com ), and it took more than 10 minutes, because the reader wasn't attached, and they had trouble connecting it. The year is 2011, it's not supposed to happen. The location as was said before, is really great - a few (10-20) minutes walk from major sites, and also close to bus lines 40 and 64 that travel to the Vatican, and to the underground that goes to Piazza del Popolo. All in all, it's ok, and I would go back there, just don't expect too much. -We didn't have breakfast and didn't want the AC (on pay). The hotel has no parking lot of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and helpful staff, well located and affordable for Roma”
Reviews.Author: Janis1974
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome to see the sites, the streets and the people so this hotel was perfect. Well located near Piazza Republica just off Via Nazionale, it is close to Termini but not in the cruddy area right around the train station. You can easily get to all the amazing Roman sites and to Trastevere using the many and frequent buses that leave from Via Nazionale. The staff was extremely nice and helpful, answering all our questions, giving us recommendations of the place to find the specific print we were looking for, etc. During our mishap with a car rental they made us espressos and brought as bowls of fresh cherries while we waited in their reception area! The rooms are affordable for Rome, decent and clean, some on the smallish side, and continental breakfast is fine. Viva Roma!

Reviews.Title: “In one word - 'Average'”
Reviews.Author: Sorbo1510
Reviews.Content: We were 3 to a room and I have to say that we truly felt like sardines. Although the hotel is located conveniently (near Repubblica metro station), but beyond that, there's nothing to write home about. No frills, strange painted celing, small bathrooms and a meagre breakfast. I'll bet Rome has better hotels to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overview”
Reviews.Author: MayGoEZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during our trip to Rome for 5 nights. Here are my observations: -Small boutique hotel -Rooms are basic with mini bar, tv(few Italian channels and English music channel only), small bathroom with shower -Only amentu given is a small bar of soap. Hand and bath towels are provided. -There is a charge of 10 Euros to use the small room safe that will hold your wallet, passport, keys. Not large enough to put a notebook computer in-approx size 4'X5". -Breakfast is complimentary but should be discontinued due to cheap products used and presentation. Consists of 2 cereals, bread, and coffee/milk machine. The beverage taste is watered down, bread 7 cereal taste awful. I ate breakfast at the small cafe across the street from hotel that served fresh bakery and descent coffee, juice, fruit, etc.. -Hotel does provide free wi-fi internet service in the room and it works well. -Hotel manager and staff are friendly and helpful. -Hotel offers a good rate and was okay for my stay because I didn't spend much time at the hotel. But would not consider this hotel for longer stay or comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: elina_whitesnake
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the center of Rome. It is near Repubblica metro stop, and near bus stops. Very friendly staff. The room was very clean. The only problem was that it was a bit noisy, because you can hear the kitchen staff in the morning and the other tenants-if they are noisy. You also get 30 minutes of free internet use of th ehotel's computer. In general I would highly recommend it for a couple, or a group of friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Hotel- highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Samyukth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elide for four days in August. The rooms and hotel are minimalistic- small room, pay extra for Air Conditioning (10 euros a night), small bathroom, small tv with Italian channels only. But the location is excellent, close to the train station (Repubblica and Termini) as well as bus stops. We didnt eat breakfast in the hotel as it was just OK. There are a lot of restaurants and vendors a short walk away which I recommend. If you are flying into Rome, the hotel is very close to the Termini station which has a direct bus service from the airport (4 euros a person, can be booked when exiting the airport). Overall, good experience and would stay again if I went to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing surprise”
Reviews.Author: Dror10
Reviews.Content: I selected the hotel one night befor arrival. I was surprise to find that the rooms are fully renovated. The shower was great and the bed superb. The location is hust in the middle of Rome with walking distance to any location. I truly recommend it. The rooms are not big but sufficient. I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Generally ok, but decent location”
Reviews.Author: minutemat
Reviews.Content: Generally ok but if you're not fussy this hotel is worth it for the convenience of location! We checked in late so took a walk to a local bar nearby. When that closed we walked a few minutes down the main street only to come face to face with the Trajan Column and the breathtaking Victor Emmanuel Monument all lit up, with the Coliseum about 5 minutes walk to our left! The hotel itself is pleasant enough, although basic. We stayed at the start of Winter so it was fairly cold with no heater that we could see. The gentleman on reception was amiable and came downstairs to help find me a place to park. However, in the morning when I was a whole 15 minutes late for breakfast I was told I could not have any, despite the cereal and bowls still being laid out. This I thought was astoundingly bad service. Together with the cold rooms I'd otherwise choose somewhere else but bearing in mind the location I might be swayed to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: swirlywirly
Reviews.Content: Can't go wrong with the Elide! The hotel looked to have been totally refurbished for this season, the room could not be faulted, Fridge, TV (you'll never need it), stand up Shower etc in spotless bathroom. Sheets and towels changed at least once in our three night stay. Air con is provided, but for an additional charge. The room was basic, tiled floor, white walls, but could not be faulted. plenty of wardrobe draws etc. My boyfriend and I found the hotel from the station no problem, its far enough away from Termini that you need never know its there but close enough for the trudge home with the cases (ten min walk, and off Via Nacional) All the main sights are within walking distance, (trevi fountain 5-10 minute walk) but for anything on the west bank of the Tiber (St Peter's etc) an open top bus ticket is probably your best bet, about €16 for a 24 hr pass on the 110 trambus from the station all day. Theres no getting away from the fact that Rome is a noisy place, a real 24 hr city and with the windows open you will be awoken once or twice, but with all the walking we did it didn't keep us awake long! One point to note was there is a slightly unusual practice (to me anyway) whereby the room keys are deposited behind the reception desk when the guest leaves the hotel. The reception is open 24 hrs, and you will be buzzed in on the intercom, the hotel occupies the first and second floors (not the ground) but there is a lift. We paid €90 a night, and I would be surprised to find better for less.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mratliff
Reviews.Content: After leaving our camera in the hotel safe we figured we had lost our entire trip worth of pictures...not to mention and expensive camera. Not so, the hotel staff got the camera and sent it back to us via registered mail. They would not even give us a price for shipping so we could pay them back. Thank you for such a kind gesture. Mike Ratliff and Lea Casperson

Reviews.Title: “Like a stylish (but small) new apartment”
Reviews.Author: Gallet
Reviews.Content: Booked cheaply online at booking.com Hotel is an easy walk from Termini and Republica stations. The area is not scary even late at night. Whole hotel has been recently refurbished. Rooms are tasteful cream and brown colours. Looks like a stylish new apartment. Things I liked: bar fridge, flat plasma screen TV mounted on the wall, extra blankets, good location near transport and food outlets, 24 hour reception, cheap price. Things I didn't like: front rooms can hear street traffic quite loudly even though windows are double glazed, pillows are really flat, bedroom has tile floor so cold to walk on, shower cubicle very small (prob 80cm x 80cm) but has detachable handheld shower head so you can stand on the spot, you have to buzz to get inside after about 8pm, breakfast from 7:15am so not for early risers. For the price you pay, it is clean, stylish and safe and near everything. Rooms are not laid out to maximise space - they could have made it a lot more if they positioned things better.

Reviews.Title: “I find it hard to think of anything to recommend about the Elide”
Reviews.Author: Blackbird_7
Reviews.Content: I was on a longish holiday, staying in various types of accommodation around Europe. The Elide was the low point on my trip, and the only positive about it was that everywhere else seemed great in comparison. The room was clean enough, and it DID have its own bathroom. But... I was placed in the ST room. This room was so small that it would not have fitted a double bed. I could sit on the bed with my back against one wall, and easily rest my feet on the opposite wall. There was a table, but this was the only place I could place my luggage, so essentially the room was taken up with a single bed, my single bag, and the bar fridge with the TV sitting on it. There WERE a set of draws in the room, but they sat under the table, with no room to roll them out for use. Kinda pointless. There were pipes running from the window into the bathroom, where I discovered a large water heater taking up so much room that you could not sit on the toilet normally. This water heater (I can only assume that is what it was!) would click on and off throughout the night and hum loudly enough as it did so that I would shut the bathroom door to try to muffle the noise. The TV had a remote control that was A) covered in something, and B) not in any way compatible with the TV. It wasn't even the same brand! Luckily the room was so small that the TV was rarely out of arms reach. The hotel lobby is on the 1st floor, so each time you want to enter the hotel you have to buzz up and wait to be buzzed in. The staff in the hotel were mixed. I asked one to recommend a place to eat and a laundromat, and he obliged and provided a map. The other just looked blankly at me, and tried to add mystery 'snacks from the mini bar' to my bill when I went to pay. The window opened up into a dirty.. courtyard? There was constant noise from this area, including construction noise. If you angled yourself at the bottom of the window and look up as high as you can, it is just possible to see if there is blue skies or not. I wanted to shut the windows at night to reduce the noise, but the heat of the water-heater meant that this was not feasible. With so many other hotels in Rome, I cannot see a reason to possibly recommend this place, and would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay - Will go back!!”
Reviews.Author: St��phanie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elide Hotel for 2 nights. Of course in the beginning i was a bit ... how to put it 'cautious' as of where i was going to stay. I didnt want a 4star hotel but i wanted clean. This hotel was perfect! Good value for money and more - PERFECT LOCATION!! We stayed in room 26, very spacious but i will tell you that the bathroom was a bit smelly, a bit old. Other than that, very clean and excellent staff at the reception. It really made our stay wonderful. The receptionist told us that by january all the rooms will be redone, painted etc so it will even better. A big 9/10 for the hotel. The breakfast is not included but if you're in Italy mind as well live the city like the roman right?? Enjoy your stay and the wonderful city ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Tragic Elide”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrible. Power kept tripping out and rooms poorly maintained. Location good, and that's all that's good about this place. Only if nothing else is available!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Elide
HotelInfo.Address: Via Firenze 50, 00184 Rome, Italy
